name: Abby T. Miller

responsibilities: Community Growth Operations Manager (April 2015 - present) I lead a small team that maintains and streamlines Community Growth team processes, and support Community Managers as a pluralistic-style manager. And I'm still a part-time podcast producer.

Senior Community Growth Specialist (September 2012 - April 2015) That title is just a fancy attempt to describe being a jack of all trades on the Community Growth team. I functioned as a part-time community manager, a part-time hiring coordinator, and a part-time operations manager. And a part-time podcast producer.

Community Development Team Lead (July 2011 - September 2012) (This was the organization formerly known as CHAOS.) I observed and advised a team that oversaw special projects and community events with the goal of strengthening and growing individual sites within the Stack Exchange network. Provided operational support ("servant leadership") and reported progress to the Chief of Staff.

Research and administrative support for retained executive search and coaching firm founded by Joanna Miller. Services include retained search, unbundled search services such as research, pre-search market studies, screening, assessment, reference checking and talent pipeline. Performance, transition, career, new-in-role and on-boarding coaching.

workExperience.organization: Northwestern University Summer Music Theatre Festival
responsibilities: Stage managed three summers' worth of Dominography. Facilitated communication between actors, directors, administrators, and creative team members. Coordinated artistic rehearsals, technical rehearsals, and performances, merging all technical and artistic aspects of production while ensuring that the team kept to an intricate schedule.

Organized a semester-long seminar on technical theatre with Garen Checkley during our junior year. Structured the curriculum and syllabus, scheduled weekly guest lecturers, and taught lessons. Developed and administered two final exams, one written and one based on practical skills.

unsupported: "Abby T. Miller is not only extremely talented at juggling multiple challenging tasks at once, she is also a
pleasure to work with. Abby is unique in her ability to merge detail-orientation with a big-picture thought
process, making her an strong asset to any organization she is involved with."
, worked directly with Abby T. at Northwestern University Department of Theatre
